title: F5 key to refresh page
content:
In an archived thread, this question was asked.

"I used to be able to refresh a page by hitting the F5 key. That does not seem to work anymore. Is there a keyboard shortcut for refresh, or can I create one?"

Unfortunately, he asked for a keyboard shortcut, instead of a fix or a solution, and he got several, most of which didn't work, at least for me. One that did work was Ctrl+R. I had also found another that worked, which was Fn+F5. That was a pain to use since those keys on my keyboard are on opposite sides of the keyboard, so it took both hands to press the keys.

However, instead of shortcuts or workarounds,' I would like to offer an actual solution to this very annoying problem. '

Option one. The function lock has been toggled, but you can toggle it back to the F5 key. If the Escape key on your keyboard has a lock symbol, press Fn+Esc. The issue should now be resolved. Press F5 and check if everything is back to normal. This will also fix the same problem in Windows, i.e. the F5 key not refreshing the screen in File Explorer and other programs.

Option two. If that does not work, search and open Windows Mobility Center. You will have an option under “Function Key Row” to choose between Function Key or Multimedia Key. Choose the Function Key option (or the other way round) to fix the issue. This option did not work for me as there was no “Function Key Row” in my Windows Mobility Center.

Option three. You can also enter the BIOS and make this change under Function Key Behavior. I didn't try this one because I had already fixed the problem with the Esc key.

title: Password amendment
content:
Hi there,

My name's Jack Murphy. I have a recommendation for a feature on Firefox, but I'm also building my portfolio as an entry-level software engineer.

So, the improvement Firefox needs to make is that a special character needs to be inserted in the 'randomised password' feature. It's a very useful feature, but more websites are requiring a special character alongside uppercase/lowercase letters, and numbers. For a couple of websites now I've had to add in a special character myself to the auto-generated password, and then save the result.

It would be quite an easy fix. I would love to get involved in making that fix, if the relevant part is open-source. However, as there are security considerations, it might not be....

If not it's still worth getting in touch!

All the best, Jack Murphy

p.s what other ways are there for an early-career software developer to get involved with mozilla? (UK based)

title: issue with mouse clicks in v105.X
content:
Ever since V105.x came out, I've had massive issues with mouse clicks. Firefox has seemed to have a very exacting definition of what is and is not clickable when browsing every website I go to. It used to have a nicely large area to make a lick and have it activate the link I was trying for. Now, when I want to click, to say open an email in Gmail, I need to find the most exact spot in the UI to be the active/clickable location to use the link. I have to find the most exact spot to use the check boxes to select items. I can't drag labels over because I cannot find the correct spot on the page anymore to drag the link, but not open it. The Unread and Delete buttons have the same kind of issue: in Firefox V105.X, I have to find the perfect spot to click them to be usable. Otherwise, I'm sitting there clicking all around trying to find it.

I have similar issues on sites like CNN or Facebook. On CNN, I have to hunt down the spot in the link to open a story. Firefox recognizes my mouse is over the link, but I have to hunt to find the clickable spot in the entire link. In Facebook, if I click into a picture, the entire page is slightly off when viewing. So the arrows to click to a next picture may get me the the next picture or it might get me to an entirely different page I can't see but apparently registered a click on.

I've checked my mouse drivers and those haven't changed in years. Just trying to correct a typo in the last sentence took 4 mouse clicks to get the cursor in the text field to the correct spot, when I'd lined it up to be next to the letter to correct. It's nearly impossible to drag a browser tab to a new position as I can hardly ever find the correct spot on the tab that makes it active anymore. Even just clicking to make a tab the active/viewable tab is hard as hell. Closing one is similarly frustrating.

I'm on Win11.

title: Fullscreen mode
content:
I have written a javascript app frontend. In it I set the screen to fullscreen using:

var requestFullScreen = docEl.requestFullscreen || docEl.mozRequestFullScreen || docEl.webkitRequestFullScreen || docEl.msRequestFullscreen;

if(!doc.fullscreenElement && !doc.mozFullScreenElement && !doc.webkitFullscreenElement && !doc.msFullscreenElement) { requestFullScreen.call(docEl); }

This works just fine. The user can exit fullscreen by pressing Esc.

I also download files in the app. The problem is that the downloads don't show in fullscreen, and I do not want the user to have to press Esc to see them.

But if you do press Esc, and then enter fullscreen mode using F11 the downloads then always show in fullscreen.

It seems like there are two different fullscreen states - one reached by F11 and one by the javascript commands. How can I get both to behave as if they are the F11 one?

many thanks Richard

title: WebGL2.0 doesn't allow flipping frame with blitFramebuffer()
content:
Hi. So in desktop OpenGL it is totally valid to write the following in order to flip the frame vertically into dst buffer: 

 glBlitFramebuffer(0, h, w, 0, 0, 0, w, h, GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, GL_NEAREST));

In WebGL if I do this:

gl.blitFramebuffer(0, h,w,0 , 0, 0, w, h, gl.COLOR_BUFFER_BIT, gl.NEAREST);

I am getting WebGL warning: blitFramebuffer: If the source is multisampled, then the source and dest regions must match exactly.

Similar error is reported in Chrome.

When I am looking into the related C++ code I can see this: 

        if (dstX0 != srcX0 ||            dstX1 != srcX1 ||            dstY0 != srcY0 ||            dstY1 != srcY1)        {            webgl->ErrorInvalidOperation("%s: If the source is multisampled, then the"                                         " source and dest regions must match exactly.",                                         funcName);            return;        }

I am not sure why this restriction has been imposed. GLES2/3 support this kind of dimensions setup with no errors. Can someone explain the reason behind this? And if it is a bug/missed functionality, where should it be reported?
creator: ivspcom

title: Process manager - identify which window is hogging memory
content:
The process manager tells me which window/process is hogging memory. But I have multiple windows open on multiple workspaces. How do I switch to that window so that I can see what it is and decide what to do about it?

Until recently, clicking on a window listed in the process manager would bring that window to the current workspace (ubuntu/xfce). That changed recently. Now clicking/double-clicking does nothing and there only seems to be the option to kill the process.

I guess I can kill it and then look at recently closed windows to see what it was. But that is a bodgy.

Can I fix the process manager so that when I click on one of its listed windows, I get taken to that window on the workspace where it resides? (It always was inconvenient when previously, double-clicking on the window in the list, brought that window to the current workspace. You had then to work out where it had come from if you wanted to put it back).

Firefox's window/workspace management is otherwise excellent. It's the best in my opinion. When it starts-up, for example, it puts all the windows back on the workspaces where they were when it was last closed. Very nice.
creator: ackerbilk

title: How can I configure Firefox to load a bookmarklet just after loading any URL under a specific domain?
content:
Imagine a web `example.com` + a bookmarklet that powers `example.com` up

  • Suppose a page `example.com` for which I don't control the source code, but I use on a daily basis (imagine any 3rt party cloud system: Trello, Notion, Clickup, Zoho, whatever...)
  • Suppose a bookmarlet we've done to change colors, make clicks, submit forms, and, in general, improve my daily workflows and productivity when using `example.com`

The usual workflow is

1) I first open `example.com` in the browser clicking bookmark `A`, `B`, `C`, `D`... multiple bookmarks that take me to specific pages of that application (different trello boards, different docs in google docs, different zoho customer profiles, etc.). For example bookmark `A` could lead to `example.com/home.html` and bookmark `B` to `example.com/another-page.html` 2) Execute the bookmarklet clicking bookmark `Z`

Now that the bookmarklet has been tested, we plan to extend this usage to all teammates in the company, but we want them to do not have to click two times, one for the page, one for the javascript injection; but click one single time and let firefox to do the job.

Question

How can I instruct Firefox so that "each time you are opening ANY page under the domain `example.com` (no matter if clicking a bookmark, clicking a link, or typing the URL in) then you, Firefox, have to load this specific bookmarklet after loading the page"?

PD: xposted here: https://superuser.com/questions/1746812/how-can-i-configure-firefox-to-load-a-bookmarklet-just-after-loading-any-url-und

title: Problem launching firefox with same profile from the command line and from a java application
content:
We are launching firefox from the command line with a specific profile. We sometimes also need to launch firefox from a java application using that exact same profile. But when we do that, we get the error:

"Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To use Firefox, you must first close the existing Firefox process, restart your device, or use a different profile."

We do not get the error when launching from the java application if firefox was not previously started from the command line.

To say that again another way, - If we launch firefox from the command line two times, each time with the same profile, it works fine. - If we launch firefox from the Java application two times, each time with the same profile, it works fine. - But if we launch firefox from the command line then launch firefox from the java application, firefox won't launch due to the error above.

This is firefox 91.13.0esr 64-bit on Linux (CentOS 7).

Thank you for any help you can give.
creator: cynthia.j.freedman

title: Não consigo acessar minha conta pelo firefox, somente pelo Google
content: Não estou conseguindo acessar minha conta de e-mail pelo firefox como de costume, parece bloqueada, eu mesmo sem querer devo ter bloqueada, agora só posso acessar pelo navegador Google, gostaria que voltasse como estava acostumada. Preciso muito acessar pelo nootbook, sempre tenho anexos para enviar... Atenciosamente, Sueli
creator: suelilocks

title: PRECISO DE AJUDA
content:
Pessoal acho que meu navegador esta hackeado desde o mes de maio, meu celular foi invadido no mes de março devido a um jogo de poker online e desde que isso aconteceu nao consegui mais ganahr dinheiro nesse jogo. Jogo poker ha dois anos e faz parte da minha renda, e desde que isso aconteceu eu nao consegui mais pagar nem meu cartao de credito.

Ja fiz diversas analises e encontrei uma firmwaree do site original que eu costumava jogar, e reportei os problemas aos caisnos que sou cliente mas nao deram atencao e a falha esta longe de ser resolvida. Entretanto, verificando o firefox, acredito que ate o site da google que eu entro com minha conta de email pode ser um site falso, pois minha localização nunca aparece no local onde estou, e lembro que isso tambem acontecia com o celular que foi hackeado.

Estou enviando os codigos pra vcs analisarem pois encontrei um script no site do google: data async type lbsc.

Acredito que esse script que e o responsavel por manipular as datas e os meus resultados, e isso esta interferindo ateg nos meus aplicativos bancarios. Nao sei mais o que faço, meu prejuizo esta na meia dos 20 mil reais, e ate as pesquisas que eu faço so aparecem resultados de 2021, nao aparecem os resultaods na ordem normal. Ta bem estranho.

Alem disso, agora mudei do windows para o linux e o problema persiste, pois ate o navegador firefox ta com um bloqeio na atualização e nao consigo atualizar de jeito nenhum. Preciso de ajuda.

a ultima imagem mostra que o navegador esta com um bloqueio que nao consigo atualizar.
creator: prpix2022

title: Bookmarks Are Gone
content:
I am using Firefox portable. I received a prompt that an update was available, so I downloaded it. Now, ALL of my bookmarks disappeared. The version it downloaded is 105.0.3

I'm VERY not happy ! * I had 100's of bookmarks !! If there had been a way to turn off updates, I would have done it a long time ago.

I assume there isn't any way to retrieve them ??
creator: -Daryl-

title: Bookmarks lost and no backup file on my pc
content: Recently I had a bug that I could not watch any videos on Firefox, I solved it by uninstalling and installing it again with two compatibility checkmarks... what really is important is that when I logged on my new account, I lost all my bookmarks and could not retrieve them, have no backup file on my computer. I spent hundreds of hours collecting my bookmarks to lose it all...
creator: holyqueenolivia
